intro: Echites lasiocarpus, commonly known as the woolly fruit-bearing plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woolly texture on its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its fruit is a capsule that contains small, hairy seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Echites lasiocarpus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
